name: Quick Beef Patty and Tuna Wrap with Colorful Vegetables
description: Dive into the world of healthy eating without sacrificing taste with our 'S&r Meets Healthyfied' recipe. Perfect for those who are looking for high-protein and high-fiber options, this recipe combines the goodness of fresh vegetables like broccoli, capsicum, and tomatoes with the hearty satisfaction of a quarter pound beef patty and a tuna wrap. It's a unique blend that brings together health and flavor in each bite, making it an excellent choice for anyone looking to enjoy healthy recipes without compromise.

recipeInstructions.text: Place all vegetables (tomatoes, broccoli, and capsicums) in a colander or strainer. Rinse them under cold running water for about 30 seconds. Shake off excess water and pat dry with a clean towel.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 1

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the broccoli into small florets (small tree-like pieces) of about 3 cm each. Cut the green and red capsicums into 2 cm squares. Halve the cherry tomatoes and chop the regular tomatoes into small cubes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 2

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a grill pan or regular frying pan over medium-high heat (no oil needed if using a non-stick pan). Place the beef patty in the hot pan. Cook for 2-3 minutes on each side for medium-rare, 3-4 minutes for medium, or 4-6 minutes for well-done. The patty is ready when the internal temperature reaches 71°C (160°F) or when it's no longer pink in the center.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 3

recipeInstructions.text: While the beef patty is cooking, heat another small pan over low heat. Place the tuna wrap in the pan and warm it for about 1-2 minutes on each side. It should be just warm, not crispy or dry.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 4

recipeInstructions.text: Take a serving plate and place the cooked beef patty and warmed tuna wrap in the center.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 5

recipeInstructions.text: Arrange the prepared vegetables (broccoli florets, capsicum pieces, and tomatoes) around the patty and wrap. Create a colorful display by alternating the different colored vegetables.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 6

recipeInstructions.text: Serve immediately while the beef patty and tuna wrap are still warm.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 7
